private_information: I am the left peg and currently hold the stack of disks from top to bottom: A, B, C, D, E, F, G
Disks are labeled A smallest through G largest
peg_left.goal: Assist the orchestrator by reporting observations and local move constraints so that all disks end up on the right peg in correct order

private_information: I am the middle peg and currently empty
peg_middle.goal: Assist the orchestrator by reporting observations and local move constraints so that all disks end up on the right peg in correct order

private_information: I am the right peg and currently empty
peg_right.goal: Assist the orchestrator by reporting observations and local move constraints so that all disks end up on the right peg in correct order

orchestrator.goal: Produce a complete PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownward solver that moves all disks from the left peg to the right peg obeying Tower of Hanoi rules

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi puzzle with three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are seven disks labeled A through G, where A is the smallest and G is the largest.
Only one disk may be moved at a time.
A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Initial state is left peg containing disks top to bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G; middle and right pegs empty.
Goal state is right peg containing disks top to bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G and left and middle pegs empty.

propose_moves.system_prompt: You are peg_left. Analyze your private information and the public puzzle description and produce a concise report of local observations, legal immediate moves from your peg, and any constraints relevant to moving disks. Do not output PDDL. Provide the report as a structured list of facts and observations that the orchestrator can consume.

You are peg_middle. Analyze your private information and the public puzzle description and produce a concise report of local observations, legal immediate moves from your peg, and any constraints relevant to moving disks. Do not output PDDL. Provide the report as a structured list of facts and observations that the orchestrator can consume.

You are peg_right. Analyze your private information and the public puzzle description and produce a concise report of local observations, legal immediate moves from your peg, and any constraints relevant to moving disks. Do not output PDDL. Provide the report as a structured list of facts and observations that the orchestrator can consume.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent orchestration and PDDL modeling for classical planners. Using the public information and the observations reported by the peg agents, produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownward solver that models the seven-disk Tower of Hanoi instance and achieves the specified goal. Your domain must model pegs and disks, enforce that only one disk moves at a time, and forbid placing larger disks on smaller disks. Use explicit predicates for disk sizes or ordering as needed. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep the actions distinct and include comments or a brief metadata line indicating compatibility with FastDownward.
